def_cn: 整个的；全部的；所有的
def_en: You use all to indicate that you are referring to the whole of a particular group or thing or to everyone or everything of a particular kind.

def_cn: 整个（时间段）
def_en: You use all to refer to the whole of a particular period of time.

def_cn: 全部；一切
def_en: You use all to refer to a situation or to life in general.

def_cn: （用于强调真实性或普遍性）完全，遍及，一直
def_en: You use all to emphasize that something is completely true, or happens everywhere or always, or on every occasion.

def_cn: （用于句首表示强调某事的唯一重要性）一切，全部
def_en: You use all at the beginning of a clause when you are emphasizing that something is the only thing that is important.

def_cn: (表示强调）非常真诚/极有可能
def_en: You use all in expressions such as in all sincerity and in all probability to emphasize that you are being sincere or that something is very likely.

def_cn: （用于形容词前，强调暂时的一种特征）
def_en: You can use all in front of an adjective when you want to emphasize a quality that affects someone or something temporarily.

def_cn: （球赛等双方得分相等时）每人，各（如three all为“三平”）
def_en: You use all when you are talking about an equal score in a game. For example, if the score is three all, both players or teams have three points.

def_cn: （用于all the more, all the better等结构中）更加，愈加
def_en: All is used in structures such as all the more or all the better to mean even more or even better than before.

def_cn: (用于强调）全看到了/全做过
def_en: You use all in expressions such as seen it all and done it all to emphasize that someone has had a lot of experience of something.

def_cn: 首先；尤其是
def_en: You say above all to indicate that the thing you are mentioning is the most important point.

def_cn: 毕竟；终究
def_en: You use after all when introducing a statement which supports or helps explain something you have just said.

def_cn: 竟然;居然
def_en: You use after all when you are saying that something that you thought might not be the case is in fact the case.

def_cn: 等等；甚至包括
def_en: You use and all when you want to emphasize that what you are talking about includes the thing mentioned, especially when this is surprising or unusual.

def_cn: 总的说来；从各方面来说；总之
def_en: You use all in all to introduce a summary or general statement.

def_cn: （用于否定句、条件句、疑问句等的句末）全然，一点，根本，究竟
def_en: You use at all at the end of a clause to give emphasis in negative statements, conditional clauses, and questions.

def_cn: 除了…都
def_en: All but a particular person or thing means everyone or everything except that person or thing.

def_cn: 几乎；差不多
def_en: You use all but to say that something is almost the case.

def_cn: 虽然;尽管
def_en: You use for all to indicate that the thing mentioned does not affect or contradict the truth of what you are saying.

def_cn: （用于强调）我可不知道/他才不在乎呢
def_en: You use for all in phrases such as for all I know, and for all he cares, to emphasize that you do not know something or that someone does not care about something.

def_cn: 尽最大努力;竭尽全力
def_en: If you give your all or put your all into something, you make the maximum effort possible.

def_cn: 总共;合计
def_en: In all means in total.

def_cn: 精疲力竭的
def_en: If you say that you are all in, you mean that you are extremely tired.

def_cn: （价格）包括一切的，全包的
def_en: If something such as an activity is a particular price all in, that price includes everything that is offered.

def_cn: （用于强调first, last或最高级形容词或副词）最，最为
def_en: You use of all to emphasize the words 'first' or 'last', or a superlative adjective or adverb.

def_cn: 在所有的人(或事物）中偏偏
def_en: You use of all in expressions such as of all people or of all things when you want to emphasize someone or something surprising.

def_cn: （用于对他人的言行表示愤怒或吃惊）真不要脸/运气真好
def_en: You use all in expressions like of all the cheek or of all the luck to emphasize how angry or surprised you are at what someone else has done or said.

def_cn: 一共；足足；至少
def_en: You use all of before a number to emphasize how small or large an amount is.

def_cn: 所有的人;全体
def_en: One and all means everyone present or everyone in a particular group.

def_cn: （用于否定句中削弱语气）那么
def_en: You use all that in statements with negative meaning when you want to weaken the force of what you are saying.

def_cn: 没别的了；就是这么回事
def_en: You can say that's all at the end of a sentence when you are explaining something and want to emphasize that nothing more happens or is the case.

def_cn: 好倒是好；固然是好
def_en: You use all very well to suggest that you do not really approve of something or you think that it is unreasonable.
